text_entry: all-hailed me 'Thane of Cawdor;' by which title,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: before, these weird sisters saluted me, and referred

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: me to the coming on of time, with 'Hail, king that

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: shalt be!' This have I thought good to deliver

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: thee, my dearest partner of greatness, that thou

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: mightst not lose the dues of rejoicing, by being

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: ignorant of what greatness is promised thee. Lay it

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: to thy heart, and farewell.'

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Glamis thou art, and Cawdor; and shalt be

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What thou art promised: yet do I fear thy nature;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: It is too full o' the milk of human kindness

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: To catch the nearest way: thou wouldst be great;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Art not without ambition, but without

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: The illness should attend it: what thou wouldst highly,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That wouldst thou holily; wouldst not play false,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And yet wouldst wrongly win: thou'ldst have, great Glamis,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That which cries 'Thus thou must do, if thou have it;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And that which rather thou dost fear to do

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Than wishest should be undone.' Hie thee hither,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That I may pour my spirits in thine ear;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And chastise with the valour of my tongue

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: All that impedes thee from the golden round,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Which fate and metaphysical aid doth seem

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: To have thee crown'd withal.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What is your tidings?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The king comes here to-night.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Thou'rt mad to say it:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Is not thy master with him? who, were't so,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Would have inform'd for preparation.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: So please you, it is true: our thane is coming:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: One of my fellows had the speed of him,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Who, almost dead for breath, had scarcely more

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Than would make up his message.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Give him tending;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: He brings great news.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Exit Messenger

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: The raven himself is hoarse

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That croaks the fatal entrance of Duncan

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Under my battlements. Come, you spirits

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That tend on mortal thoughts, unsex me here,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And fill me from the crown to the toe top-full

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Of direst cruelty! make thick my blood;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Stop up the access and passage to remorse,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That no compunctious visitings of nature

speaker: LADY MACBETH

speaker: LADY MACBETH

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And take my milk for gall, you murdering ministers,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Wherever in your sightless substances

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: You wait on nature's mischief! Come, thick night,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And pall thee in the dunnest smoke of hell,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: That my keen knife see not the wound it makes,

speaker: LADY MACBETH

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: To cry 'Hold, hold!'

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Enter MACBETH

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Great Glamis! worthy Cawdor!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Greater than both, by the all-hail hereafter!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Thy letters have transported me beyond

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: This ignorant present, and I feel now

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: The future in the instant.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: My dearest love,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Duncan comes here to-night.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And when goes hence?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To-morrow, as he purposes.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: O, never

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Shall sun that morrow see!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Your face, my thane, is as a book where men

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: May read strange matters. To beguile the time,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Look like the time; bear welcome in your eye,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Your hand, your tongue: look like the innocent flower,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: But be the serpent under't. He that's coming

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Must be provided for: and you shall put

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: This night's great business into my dispatch;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Which shall to all our nights and days to come

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Give solely sovereign sway and masterdom.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: We will speak further.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Only look up clear;

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: To alter favour ever is to fear:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Leave all the rest to me.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE VI. Before Macbeth's castle.

speaker: LADY MACBETH

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: This castle hath a pleasant seat; the air

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Nimbly and sweetly recommends itself

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Unto our gentle senses.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: This guest of summer,

speaker: BANQUO

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Where they most breed and haunt, I have observed,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: The air is delicate.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Enter LADY MACBETH

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: See, see, our honour'd hostess!

text_entry: The love that follows us sometime is our trouble,

text_entry: Which still we thank as love. Herein I teach you

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: How you shall bid God 'ild us for your pains,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: And thank us for your trouble.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: All our service

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: In every point twice done and then done double

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Were poor and single business to contend

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Against those honours deep and broad wherewith

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Your majesty loads our house: for those of old,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: And the late dignities heap'd up to them,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: We rest your hermits.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Where's the thane of Cawdor?

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: We coursed him at the heels, and had a purpose

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: To be his purveyor: but he rides well;

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: And his great love, sharp as his spur, hath holp him

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: To his home before us. Fair and noble hostess,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: We are your guest to-night.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Your servants ever

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Have theirs, themselves and what is theirs, in compt,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: To make their audit at your highness' pleasure,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Still to return your own.

speaker: DUNCAN

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Conduct me to mine host: we love him highly,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: And shall continue our graces towards him.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: By your leave, hostess.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Exeunt

text_entry: I have thee not, and yet I see thee still.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Art thou not, fatal vision, sensible

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To feeling as to sight? or art thou but

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A dagger of the mind, a false creation,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Proceeding from the heat-oppressed brain?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I see thee yet, in form as palpable

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As this which now I draw.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou marshall'st me the way that I was going;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And such an instrument I was to use.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Mine eyes are made the fools o' the other senses,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Or else worth all the rest; I see thee still,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And on thy blade and dudgeon gouts of blood,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which was not so before. There's no such thing:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: It is the bloody business which informs

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thus to mine eyes. Now o'er the one halfworld

text_entry: Alarum'd by his sentinel, the wolf,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With Tarquin's ravishing strides, towards his design

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Moves like a ghost. Thou sure and firm-set earth,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Words to the heat of deeds too cold breath gives.

speaker: MACBETH

text_entry: Hark!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come in, without there!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter LENNOX

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: What's your grace's will?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Saw you the weird sisters?

text_entry: No, my lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Came they not by you?

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: No, indeed, my lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Infected be the air whereon they ride;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And damn'd all those that trust them! I did hear

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The galloping of horse: who was't came by?

text_entry: 'Tis two or three, my lord, that bring you word

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Macduff is fled to England.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Fled to England!

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Time, thou anticipatest my dread exploits:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The flighty purpose never is o'ertook

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Unless the deed go with it; from this moment

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The very firstlings of my heart shall be

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The firstlings of my hand. And even now,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To crown my thoughts with acts, be it thought and done:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The castle of Macduff I will surprise;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Seize upon Fife; give to the edge o' the sword

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: His wife, his babes, and all unfortunate souls

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That trace him in his line. No boasting like a fool;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: This deed I'll do before this purpose cool.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But no more sights!--Where are these gentlemen?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come, bring me where they are.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: ROSS

speaker: ROSS

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Each way and move. I take my leave of you:

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Sirrah, your father's dead;

speaker: Son
text_entry: As birds do, mother.

speaker: Son
text_entry: With what I get, I mean; and so do they.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF

speaker: Son
text_entry: My father is not dead, for all your saying.

text_entry: Yes, he is dead; how wilt thou do for a father?

speaker: Son
text_entry: Nay, how will you do for a husband?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Why, I can buy me twenty at any market.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Then you'll buy 'em to sell again.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Thou speak'st with all thy wit: and yet, i' faith,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: With wit enough for thee.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Was my father a traitor, mother?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Ay, that he was.

speaker: Son
text_entry: What is a traitor?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Why, one that swears and lies.

speaker: Son
text_entry: And be all traitors that do so?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Every one that does so is a traitor, and must be hanged.

speaker: Son
text_entry: And must they all be hanged that swear and lie?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Every one.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Who must hang them?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Why,  the honest men.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Then the liars and swearers are fools,

speaker: Son
text_entry: for there are liars and swearers enow to beat

speaker: Son
text_entry: the honest men and hang up them.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Now, God help thee, poor monkey!

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: But how wilt thou do for a father?

speaker: Son
text_entry: If he were dead, you'ld weep for

speaker: Son
text_entry: him: if you would not, it were a good sign

speaker: Son

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Poor prattler, how thou talk'st!

speaker: LADY MACDUFF

text_entry: Bless you, fair dame! I am not to you known,

speaker: Messenger

speaker: Messenger

speaker: Messenger

speaker: Messenger

speaker: Messenger

speaker: First Murderer

text_entry: For that I saw the tyrant's power a-foot:

text_entry: Now is the time of help; your eye in Scotland

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Would create soldiers, make our women fight,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: To doff their dire distresses.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Be't their comfort

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: We are coming thither: gracious England hath

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Lent us good Siward and ten thousand men;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: An older and a better soldier none

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That Christendom gives out.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Would I could answer

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: This comfort with the like! But I have words

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That would be howl'd out in the desert air,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Where hearing should not latch them.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: What concern they?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: The general cause? or is it a fee-grief

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Due to some single breast?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: No mind that's honest

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: But in it shares some woe; though the main part

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Pertains to you alone.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: If it be mine,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Keep it not from me, quickly let me have it.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Let not your ears despise my tongue for ever,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Which shall possess them with the heaviest sound

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That ever yet they heard.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Hum! I guess at it.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Your castle is surprised; your wife and babes

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Savagely slaughter'd: to relate the manner,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Were, on the quarry of these murder'd deer,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: To add the death of you.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Merciful heaven!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: What, man! ne'er pull your hat upon your brows;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Give sorrow words: the grief that does not speak

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Whispers the o'er-fraught heart and bids it break.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: My children too?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Wife, children, servants, all

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That could be found.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And I must be from thence!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: My wife kill'd too?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: I have said.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Be comforted:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Let's make us medicines of our great revenge,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: To cure this deadly grief.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: He has no children. All my pretty ones?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Did you say all? O hell-kite! All?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: What, all my pretty chickens and their dam

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: At one fell swoop?

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Dispute it like a man.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I shall do so;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: But I must also feel it as a man:

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I cannot but remember such things were,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: That were most precious to me. Did heaven look on,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And would not take their part? Sinful Macduff,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: They were all struck for thee! naught that I am,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Not for their own demerits, but for mine,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Fell slaughter on their souls. Heaven rest them now!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Be this the whetstone of your sword: let grief

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Convert to anger; blunt not the heart, enrage it.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: O, I could play the woman with mine eyes

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And braggart with my tongue! But, gentle heavens,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Cut short all intermission; front to front

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Bring thou this fiend of Scotland and myself;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Within my sword's length set him; if he 'scape,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Heaven forgive him too!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: This tune goes manly.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Come, go we to the king; our power is ready;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Our lack is nothing but our leave; Macbeth

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Is ripe for shaking, and the powers above

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Put on their instruments. Receive what cheer you may:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The night is long that never finds the day.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: SCENE I. Dunsinane. Ante-room in the castle.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Enter a Doctor of Physic and a Waiting-Gentlewoman

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: I have two nights watched with you, but can perceive

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: no truth in your report. When was it she last walked?

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Since his majesty went into the field, I have seen

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: her rise from her bed, throw her night-gown upon

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: her, unlock her closet, take forth paper, fold it,

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: write upon't, read it, afterwards seal it, and again

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: return to bed; yet all this while in a most fast sleep.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: A great perturbation in nature, to receive at once

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: the benefit of sleep, and do the effects of

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: watching! In this slumbery agitation, besides her

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: walking and other actual performances, what, at any

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: time, have you heard her say?

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: That, sir, which I will not report after her.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: You may to me: and 'tis most meet you should.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Neither to you nor any one; having no witness to

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: confirm my speech.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Enter LADY MACBETH, with a taper

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Lo you, here she comes! This is her very guise;

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: and, upon my life, fast asleep. Observe her; stand close.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: How came she by that light?

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Why, it stood by her: she has light by her

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: continually; 'tis her command.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: You see, her eyes are open.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Ay, but their sense is shut.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: What is it she does now? Look, how she rubs her hands.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: It is an accustomed action with her, to seem thus

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: washing her hands: I have known her continue in

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: this a quarter of an hour.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Yet here's a spot.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Hark! she speaks: I will set down what comes from

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: her, to satisfy my remembrance the more strongly.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Out, damned spot! out, I say!--One: two: why,

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: then, 'tis time to do't.--Hell is murky!--Fie, my

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: lord, fie! a soldier, and afeard? What need we

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: fear who knows it, when none can call our power to

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: account?--Yet who would have thought the old man

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: to have had so much blood in him.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Do you mark that?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: The thane of Fife had a wife: where is she now?--

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: What, will these hands ne'er be clean?--No more o'

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: that, my lord, no more o' that: you mar all with

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: this starting.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Go to, go to; you have known what you should not.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: She has spoke what she should not, I am sure of

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: that: heaven knows what she has known.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Here's the smell of the blood still: all the

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: perfumes of Arabia will not sweeten this little

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: hand. Oh, oh, oh!

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: What a sigh is there! The heart is sorely charged.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: I would not have such a heart in my bosom for the

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: dignity of the whole body.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Well, well, well,--

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Pray God it be, sir.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: This disease is beyond my practise: yet I have known

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: those which have walked in their sleep who have died

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: holily in their beds.

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Wash your hands, put on your nightgown; look not so

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: pale.--I tell you yet again, Banquo's buried; he

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: cannot come out on's grave.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Even so?

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: To bed, to bed! there's knocking at the gate:

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: come, come, come, come, give me your hand. What's

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: done cannot be undone.--To bed, to bed, to bed!

speaker: LADY MACBETH
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Will she go now to bed?

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Directly.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Foul whisperings are abroad: unnatural deeds

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Do breed unnatural troubles: infected minds

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: To their deaf pillows will discharge their secrets:

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: More needs she the divine than the physician.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: God, God forgive us all! Look after her;

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Remove from her the means of all annoyance,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: And still keep eyes upon her. So, good night:

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: My mind she has mated, and amazed my sight.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: I think, but dare not speak.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Good night, good doctor.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: SCENE II. The country near Dunsinane.

speaker: Gentlewoman
text_entry: Drum and colours. Enter MENTEITH, CAITHNESS, ANGUS, LENNOX, and Soldiers

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: The English power is near, led on by Malcolm,

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: His uncle Siward and the good Macduff:

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: Revenges burn in them; for their dear causes

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: Would to the bleeding and the grim alarm

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: Excite the mortified man.

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Near Birnam wood

text_entry: Shall we well meet them; that way are they coming.

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: Who knows if Donalbain be with his brother?

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: For certain, sir, he is not: I have a file

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Of all the gentry: there is Siward's son,

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: And many unrough youths that even now

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Protest their first of manhood.

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: What does the tyrant?

text_entry: Some say he's mad; others that lesser hate him

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: Do call it valiant fury: but, for certain,

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: He cannot buckle his distemper'd cause

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: Within the belt of rule.

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Now does he feel

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: His secret murders sticking on his hands;

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Now minutely revolts upbraid his faith-breach;

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Those he commands move only in command,

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Nothing in love: now does he feel his title

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Hang loose about him, like a giant's robe

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Upon a dwarfish thief.

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: Who then shall blame

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: His pester'd senses to recoil and start,

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: When all that is within him does condemn

speaker: MENTEITH
text_entry: Itself for being there?

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: Well, march we on,

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: To give obedience where 'tis truly owed:

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: Meet we the medicine of the sickly weal,

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: And with him pour we in our country's purge

speaker: CAITHNESS
text_entry: Each drop of us.

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Or so much as it needs,

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: To dew the sovereign flower and drown the weeds.

speaker: LENNOX

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: SCENE III. Dunsinane. A room in the castle.

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Enter MACBETH, Doctor, and Attendants

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Bring me no more reports; let them fly all:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till Birnam wood remove to Dunsinane,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I cannot taint with fear. What's the boy Malcolm?

text_entry: Was he not born of woman? The spirits that know

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: 'Fear not, Macbeth; no man that's born of woman

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: false thanes,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Geese, villain!

speaker: Servant

speaker: MACBETH

text_entry: Thou lily-liver'd boy. What soldiers, patch?

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: Servant

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When I behold--Seyton, I say!--This push

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Will cheer me ever, or disseat me now.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I have lived long enough: my way of life

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Is fall'n into the sear, the yellow leaf;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And that which should accompany old age,

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I must not look to have; but, in their stead,

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: SEYTON
text_entry: 'Tis not needed yet.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I'll put it on.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Send out more horses; skirr the country round;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hang those that talk of fear. Give me mine armour.

speaker: MACBETH

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Not so sick, my lord,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: As she is troubled with thick coming fancies,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: That keep her from her rest.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Cure her of that.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Canst thou not minister to a mind diseased,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Pluck from the memory a rooted sorrow,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Raze out the written troubles of the brain

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And with some sweet oblivious antidote

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Cleanse the stuff'd bosom of that perilous stuff

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which weighs upon the heart?

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Therein the patient

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Must minister to himself.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Throw physic to the dogs; I'll none of it.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come, put mine armour on; give me my staff.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Seyton, send out. Doctor, the thanes fly from me.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come, sir, dispatch. If thou couldst, doctor, cast

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The water of my land, find her disease,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And purge it to a sound and pristine health,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I would applaud thee to the very echo,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That should applaud again.--Pull't off, I say.--

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What rhubarb, cyme, or what purgative drug,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Would scour these English hence? Hear'st thou of them?

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Ay, my good lord; your royal preparation

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Makes us hear something.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Bring it after me.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I will not be afraid of death and bane,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till Birnam forest come to Dunsinane.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: [Aside]  Were I from Dunsinane away and clear,

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Profit again should hardly draw me here.

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: SCENE IV. Country near Birnam wood.

speaker: Doctor

text_entry: Cousins, I hope the days are near at hand

text_entry: The wood of Birnam.

text_entry: The numbers of our host and make discovery

text_entry: 'Tis his main hope:

text_entry: And none serve with him but constrained things

text_entry: Attend the true event, and put we on

text_entry: Industrious soldiership.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: The time approaches

speaker: SIWARD

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Thoughts speculative their unsure hopes relate,

text_entry: SCENE V. Dunsinane. Within the castle.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Enter MACBETH, SEYTON, and Soldiers, with drum and colours

text_entry: Hang out our banners on the outward walls;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A cry of women within

speaker: SEYTON

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I have almost forgot the taste of fears;

text_entry: There would have been a time for such a word.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To-morrow, and to-morrow, and to-morrow,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Creeps in this petty pace from day to day

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To the last syllable of recorded time,

text_entry: And all our yesterdays have lighted fools

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The way to dusty death. Out, out, brief candle!

speaker: MACBETH

text_entry: But know not how to do it.

text_entry: Well, say, sir.

text_entry: I pull in resolution, and begin

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To doubt the equivocation of the fiend

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That lies like truth: 'Fear not, till Birnam wood

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Do come to Dunsinane:'  and now a wood

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Comes toward Dunsinane. Arm, arm, and out!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If this which he avouches does appear,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: There is nor flying hence nor tarrying here.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I gin to be aweary of the sun,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And wish the estate o' the world were now undone.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Ring the alarum-bell! Blow, wind! come, wrack!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: At least we'll die with harness on our back.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE VI. Dunsinane. Before the castle.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Drum and colours. Enter MALCOLM, SIWARD, MACDUFF, and their Army, with boughs

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Now near enough: your leafy screens throw down.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: And show like those you are. You, worthy uncle,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Shall, with my cousin, your right-noble son,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Lead our first battle: worthy Macduff and we

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Shall take upon 's what else remains to do,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: According to our order.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Fare you well.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Do we but find the tyrant's power to-night,

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Let us be beaten, if we cannot fight.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Make all our trumpets speak; give them all breath,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Those clamorous harbingers of blood and death.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: SCENE VII. Another part of the field.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Alarums. Enter MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: They have tied me to a stake; I cannot fly,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But, bear-like, I must fight the course. What's he

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That was not born of woman? Such a one

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Am I to fear, or none.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter YOUNG SIWARD

speaker: YOUNG SIWARD
text_entry: What is thy name?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou'lt be afraid to hear it.

speaker: YOUNG SIWARD
text_entry: No; though thou call'st thyself a hotter name

speaker: YOUNG SIWARD
text_entry: Than any is in hell.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: My name's Macbeth.

speaker: YOUNG SIWARD
text_entry: The devil himself could not pronounce a title

speaker: YOUNG SIWARD
text_entry: More hateful to mine ear.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: No, nor more fearful.

speaker: YOUNG SIWARD
text_entry: Thou liest, abhorred tyrant; with my sword

speaker: YOUNG SIWARD
text_entry: I'll prove the lie thou speak'st.

speaker: YOUNG SIWARD
text_entry: They fight and YOUNG SIWARD is slain

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou wast born of woman

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But swords I smile at, weapons laugh to scorn,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Brandish'd by man that's of a woman born.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Alarums. Enter MACDUFF

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: That way the noise is. Tyrant, show thy face!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: If thou be'st slain and with no stroke of mine,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: My wife and children's ghosts will haunt me still.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I cannot strike at wretched kerns, whose arms

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Are hired to bear their staves: either thou, Macbeth,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Or else my sword with an unbatter'd edge

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I sheathe again undeeded. There thou shouldst be;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: By this great clatter, one of greatest note

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Seems bruited. Let me find him, fortune!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And more I beg not.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Exit. Alarums

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Enter MALCOLM and SIWARD

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: This way, my lord; the castle's gently render'd:

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: The tyrant's people on both sides do fight;

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: The noble thanes do bravely in the war;

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: The day almost itself professes yours,

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: And little is to do.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: We have met with foes

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That strike beside us.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Enter, sir, the castle.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Exeunt. Alarums

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: SCENE VIII. Another part of the field.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Enter MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Why should I play the Roman fool, and die

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: On mine own sword? whiles I see lives, the gashes

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Do better upon them.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter MACDUFF

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Turn, hell-hound, turn!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Of all men else I have avoided thee:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But get thee back; my soul is too much charged

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With blood of thine already.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I have no words:

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: My voice is in my sword: thou bloodier villain

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Than terms can give thee out!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: They fight

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou losest labour:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As easy mayst thou the intrenchant air

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With thy keen sword impress as make me bleed:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Let fall thy blade on vulnerable crests;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I bear a charmed life, which must not yield,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To one of woman born.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Despair thy charm;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And let the angel whom thou still hast served

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Tell thee, Macduff was from his mother's womb

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Untimely ripp'd.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Accursed be that tongue that tells me so,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: For it hath cow'd my better part of man!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And be these juggling fiends no more believed,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That palter with us in a double sense;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That keep the word of promise to our ear,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And break it to our hope. I'll not fight with thee.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Then yield thee, coward,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And live to be the show and gaze o' the time:

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: We'll have thee, as our rarer monsters are,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Painted on a pole, and underwrit,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: 'Here may you see the tyrant.'

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I will not yield,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To kiss the ground before young Malcolm's feet,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And to be baited with the rabble's curse.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Though Birnam wood be come to Dunsinane,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And thou opposed, being of no woman born,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Yet I will try the last. Before my body

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I throw my warlike shield. Lay on, Macduff,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And damn'd be him that first cries, 'Hold, enough!'

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt, fighting. Alarums

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Retreat. Flourish. Enter, with drum and colours, MALCOLM, SIWARD, ROSS, the other Thanes, and Soldiers

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I would the friends we miss were safe arrived.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Some must go off: and yet, by these I see,

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: So great a day as this is cheaply bought.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Macduff is missing, and your noble son.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Your son, my lord, has paid a soldier's debt:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: He only lived but till he was a man;

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: The which no sooner had his prowess confirm'd

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: In the unshrinking station where he fought,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: But like a man he died.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Then he is dead?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Ay, and brought off the field: your cause of sorrow

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Must not be measured by his worth, for then

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: It hath no end.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Had he his hurts before?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Ay, on the front.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Why then, God's soldier be he!

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Had I as many sons as I have hairs,

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: I would not wish them to a fairer death:

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: And so, his knell is knoll'd.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: He's worth more sorrow,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: And that I'll spend for him.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: He's worth no more

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: They say he parted well, and paid his score:

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: And so, God be with him! Here comes newer comfort.

speaker: SIWARD
text_entry: Re-enter MACDUFF, with MACBETH's head

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Hail, king! for so thou art: behold, where stands

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: The usurper's cursed head: the time is free:

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I see thee compass'd with thy kingdom's pearl,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: That speak my salutation in their minds;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Whose voices I desire aloud with mine:

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Hail, King of Scotland!

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Hail, King of Scotland!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: We shall not spend a large expense of time

text_entry: Before we reckon with your several loves,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: And make us even with you. My thanes and kinsmen,

text_entry: Henceforth be earls, the first that ever Scotland

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: In such an honour named. What's more to do,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Which would be planted newly with the time,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: As calling home our exiled friends abroad

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That fled the snares of watchful tyranny;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Producing forth the cruel ministers

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Of this dead butcher and his fiend-like queen,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Who, as 'tis thought, by self and violent hands

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Took off her life; this, and what needful else

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That calls upon us, by the grace of Grace,

speaker: MALCOLM

text_entry: So, thanks to all at once and to each one,

speaker: MALCOLM
